p: Dedicated climate and health elective time could provide additional experiences for students or postgraduates looking to obtain a dual-degree or extra time allocated to research or advocacy. Cross-disciplinary collaboration is encouraged and may address shortages in available faculty to teach climate and health in some regions. In emergency medicine specifically, climate and health overlap with principles in medical education, social emergency medicine, disaster medicine, administration and operations, emergency medical services, health policy, global health, and wilderness medicine. Finally, climate change education offers a space to develop a global perspective and united approach toward equity and the pursuit of global health through standardised educational competencies across income settings [49].
